revision.text:
{{Talk header}} {{WikiProject Aviation|Airports-project=yes|class=B | b1 =y | b2 =y | b3 = y | b4 = y | b5 = y }} {{WPMILHIST|class=B | b1 =y | b2 =y | b3 =y | b4 =y | b5 =y |Aviation=y|WWII=y|US=y}} {{WikiProject United States|class=Start|importance=High|TX=yes|TX-importance=High|San Antonio=yes|SATF-importance=High}} ==Airport Passenger/Airline Statistics== I updated the article with the airport's most recent release from April 2006. [http://www.sanantonio.gov/aviation/statistics_2006.asp] Trans States is not listed yet. [[User:Clipper471|Clipper471]] 01:06, 2 July 2006 (UTC) ==2005 passenger number== The airport has released the 2006 passenger numbers. But in the process, they have reported a different 2005 passenger count. The airport's website shows '''7,425,983''' [http://www.sanantonio.gov/aviation//info_fastfacts.asp here] and '''7,437,290''' [http://www.sanantonio.gov/aviation//info_ShowPressRelease.asp?articleid=48 here]. [[User:Clipper471|Clipper471]] 17:00, 24 February 2007 (UTC) :I believe the recent introduction of '''7,437,290''' must be an error. The release of 2005 numbers [http://www.sanantonio.gov/aviation/pdf/december2005.pdf here] shows '''7,425,983'''. [[User:Clipper471|Clipper471]] 17:16, 24 February 2007 (UTC) :I received confirmation from the airport that the original release (7,425,983) did not include some charter traffic. The corrected 2005 count is 7,437,290. [[User:Clipper471|Clipper471]] 05:05, 2 March 2007 (UTC) ==Facts that need to be edited into the article== Terminal 1(A), a new 360000 square-foot terminal, was opened to the public in 1984 http://www.sanantonio.gov/aviation/info_history.asp Terminal 2 has 205,000 square feet www.sanantonio.gov/rfp/documents/AVI_WiFi_RFP.pdf Terminal B will have 204,000 square feet Terminal C will have 176,000 square feet [[User:Kgrr|Kgrr]] ([[User talk:Kgrr|talk]]) 22:42, 7 January 2008 (UTC) ==Address== IMHO, it would be helpful to add the physical location address to the "location" of the infobox. The address is 9800 Airport Boulevard, San Antonio, Texas. Any support or objections for this addition? Semper Fi! [[User:FieldMarine|FieldMarine]] ([[User talk:FieldMarine|talk]]) 21:19, 13 December 2013 (UTC) == Orphaned references in [[:San Antonio International Airport]] == I check pages listed in [[:Category:Pages with incorrect ref formatting]] to try to fix reference errors. One of the things I do is look for content for [[User:AnomieBOT/docs/OrphanReferenceFixer|orphaned references]] in wikilinked articles. I have found content for some of [[:San Antonio International Airport]]'s orphans, the problem is that I found more than one version. I can't determine which (if any) is correct for ''this'' article, so I am asking for a sentient editor to look it over and copy the correct ref content into this article. Reference named "transtats.bts.gov":
  • From [[Mason City Municipal Airport]]: {{cite web | url = http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=MCW&End_YearMonth=24168 | title = Mason City, IA: Mason City Municipal (MCW) | publisher = [[Bureau of Transportation Statistics]] (BTS), [[Research and Innovative Technology Administration]] (RITA), [[U.S. Department of Transportation]] | date = December 2013 | accessdate = June 6, 2014 }}
  • From [[Louisville International Airport]]: {{cite web | url = http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1 | title = Louisville, KY: Louisville International-Standiford Field (SDF) | publisher = [[Bureau of Transportation Statistics]] (BTS), [[Research and Innovative Technology Administration]] (RITA), [[U.S. Department of Transportation]] | date = May 2014 | accessdate= May 21, 2014 }}
  • From [[Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport]]: {{cite web | url = http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=IGM&End_YearMonth=24168 | title = Bullhead City, AZ: Laughlin/Bullhead International (IFP) | publisher = [[Bureau of Transportation Statistics]] (BTS), [[Research and Innovative Technology Administration]] (RITA), [[U.S. Department of Transportation]] | date = December 2013 | accessdate = June 5, 2014 }}
  • From [[Salt Lake City International Airport]]: {{cite web|url=http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=SLC|title=Salt Lake City, UT: Salt Lake City International (SLC)|publisher=[[Bureau of Transportation Statistics]], [[United States Department of Transportation]]|date= |accessdate=January 24, 2011}}
  • From [[Orlando International Airport]]: {{cite web |title=Orlando, FL: Orlando International (MCO)|url=http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=MCO&carrier=FACTS|publisher=Bureau of Transportation Statistics|accessdate=April 26, 2014}}
I apologize if any of the above are effectively identical; I am just a simple computer program, so I can't determine whether minor differences are significant or not. [[User:AnomieBOT|AnomieBOT]][[User talk:AnomieBOT|âš¡]] 11:56, 10 August 2014 (UTC)
